sub_title: Senior Scientist Fatigue Modelling and Testing bij SKF Group
summary:
Senior scientist in metal physics with strong interest in technology and research organization.

Interest areas

R&D in metals physics, mechanics of materials, fatigue of materials, lubricants and tribo-chemistry.
People management in a R&D environment
Customer relations in R&D/technology
Technology development and technology strategy
Joint research projects (EU funded, national funded in The Netherlands, Germany, UK, Denmark, Sweden)
Program and project management
Public-private partnerships in R&D

patents.title: METHOD OF DETERMINING FATIGUE LIFE AND REMAINING LIFE

awards.title: ASTM Award
awards.description: Award of appreciation was given for outstanding work in symposia presentations and publications and faithful academic leadership to the A.01.28 Subcommittee on Bearing and Power Transmission Steels of the American Society for Testing of Materials (ASTM). The award was given during the Bearing Steel symposium that was held in May 2019 in Denver, USA.
awards.issuer: American Society for Testing of Materials (ASTM)

awards.title: SKF Excellence Award 2017
awards.description: SKF Excellence Award was obtained with an international team for the work on Reducing Premature Bearing Failures due to White-Etching Cracks.

awards.title: Vanadium Award 2012
awards.description:
Vanadium Award 2012

For the most outstanding paper in the metallurgy and technology of vanadium and its alloys. Awarded to Dr Blanka Angelika Szost, Dr P E J Rivera-Diaz-Del-Castillo and Erik H Vegter for ‘Developing Bearing Steels Combining Hydrogen Resistance and Improved Hardness’.
http://www.iom3.org/news/2013/jul/10/iom3-awards-ceremony-2013
awards.issuer: Institute for Materials, Minerals and Mining

awards.title: SKF Excellence award
awards.description: Team member award for development of 'Thermo-Mechanical Response' model for bearing steel behavior under rolling contact fatigue.

projects.title: Hydrogen effects
projects.description: In-depth study on the effects of hydrogen on steel performance. Various publications and patents are the result of the work.

contributors.headline: Senior Scientist Fatigue Modelling and Testing bij SKF Group

authors.headline: Senior Scientist Fatigue Modelling and Testing bij SKF Group

profile_positions.description: As Scientific Director in M2i I am responsible for the direction of the R&D portfolio and its scientific level. Focus is on public-private partnerships in the area of materials science in The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description: Holding a leading position in research on bearings and related products. My focus is on metal physics of hardened steels and development of fatigue models for rolling element bearings. In this work I have a strong link with experimental physics and testing. Projects that I execute are mainly on the edge of research and commercial interests. In this work I lead cooperations with major customers in the wind industry at various universities in Europe. Part of my work is the development of novel solutions for demanding applications in industrial gearboxes. This also includes the development of novel surface treatments.
profile_positions.title: Senior scientist 'Fatigue Modelling and Testing'

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the SKF R&D program in Wind Energy with a focus on application driven innovation.
profile_positions.title: Program manager Wind Energy

profile_positions.description: Quality Manager ad interim for the SKF Research & Technology Department. In this function responsible for the Quality Management System of SKF R&D. Focus is on ISO 9001:2015 and related systems.
profile_positions.title: Quality Manager of SKF Research & Technology Development

profile_positions.description: Full management responsibility of the 'Fatigue Modelling' team at the SKF Engineering & Research Centre. This includes the daily operational management of the team, financial responsibility, initiation of major research activities in the area of Fatigue Modelling of bearing materials, exploring new research areas in Fatigue Modelling and coaching the team members in their professional development. Beside that, maintaining a network with universities, institutions and related industrial laboratories for outsourcing R&D activities and gate-keeping technologies is an important part of the job. Involvement in critical customer problems by contributing with research results, advanced measurements and presenting R&D results forms an important activity.
profile_positions.title: Team leader 'Fatigue Modelling'​ with management responsibility

profile_positions.description: Development of the competence area 'Fatigue Modelling' in the SKF research portfolio. This includes the initiation of major research activities in the area of Fatigue Modelling of bearing materials, exploring new research areas in Fatigue Modelling and coaching the team members in their professional development. Beside that, maintaining a network with universities, institutions and related industrial laboratories for outsourcing R&D activities and gate-keeping technologies is an important part of the job. Involvement in critical customer problems by contributing with research results, advanced measurements and presenting R&D results forms an important activity.
profile_positions.title: Team leader 'Fatigue Modelling'

profile_positions.description: Being an expert in the area of metal physics. Consulting to the people in the bearing business (product development, application engineering) in the field of bearing steel behaviour and steel life modelling.  Strongly developing the laboratory infrastructure by leading major investment projects for highly advanced laboratory equipment.
profile_positions.title: Focus area expert 'Materials Physics'

profile_positions.description: In this job, medium size projects (2-3 years) were initiated and executed in the area of bearing material life, X-ray diffraction, hydrogen effects in bearing steel and laboratory improvement. Small projects directly affecting  customer issues were also done. Investment projects for new laboratory equipment were also part of the tasks.
profile_positions.title: Senior researcher

profile_positions.description: Contribution to research projects, mainly to the development of a metal physics based material model that describes the behaviour of steels in ball and roller bearing applications.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: In the course 'Metallic Materials', a so called post-HBO training, I teach the subject physical measurement methods. The course deals with microscopy, scanning electron microscopy and a strong focus on X-ray diffraction. Next to that I also supervise students in their thesis research.
profile_positions.title: Part-time lecturer

profile_positions.description: In the framework of the 'Casimir' program of the Ministry of Economic Affairs, I worked part-time at the Delft University of Technology, research department of Materials Science in the group of Prof. Dr. J. Sietsma. During this period, a study was made in the area of non-destructive microstructure observations. For this a range of experimental tools was used to study microstructures, among them electromagnetic measurements (Barkhausen Noise and related techniques), thermal measurements and high energy diffraction using both synchtrotron methods and neutron diffraction. The work dealing with synchrotron diffraction has resulted in a number of measurements on ball bearings that are unique in the world. This has led to a number of publications and presentations in this area.
profile_positions.title: Casimir Fellow in Materials Science

volunteer_experiences.description: The Dutch Society for Materials Science is an organization that promotes dissemination of knowledge in the field of Materials Science by organizing knowledge events. As board member I have a general responsibility for the organization.

As member of the Cyclist Society Culemborg, I am actively promoting the use of bicycles in daily life and for leisure in and around Culemborg. This is done by engaging in actions to improve the situation for cyclists and by talking to political parties to embrace the ideas of the Cyclist Society for improvements. Ideas go from small improvements in local streets up to a large project such as a cyclist bridge over the river 'Lek' to connect Culemborg better with Utrecht and Houten.

volunteer_experiences.role: Project manager Traffic examination for school children Culemborg 2017
volunteer_experiences.description: This function was taken by me since no one else would organize the traffic examination for school children in Culemborg in 2017. For me this was simply unacceptable and therefore I started being a 'Traffic Parent' at the school of one of my daughters (OBS De Distelvlinder). Under the supervision of the national traffic organization 'Veilig Verkeer Nederland' I organized the exam for 2017 together with another parent who joined me. About 200 children from schools in Culemborg participated. The event was a success and we even managed to get exposure in some local and regional newspapers.

company.name: Gemeenschappelijke Medezeggenschapsraad Stichting Openbaar Primair Onderwijs Rivierenland

volunteer_experiences.description: The foundation OPOR is responsible for the public primary schools in the cities Culemborg and Tiel (2200 pupils and 260 employees). The participation council represents all parents of the children and th e employees. The first two years I was a member of the council and the last two years I have been chairing it. It has given me a good experience in leading meetings on complex organizational and legal matters outside my own field of expertise.

The society of parents at the primary school 'De Distelvlinder' in Culemborg organizes a range of events for children and parents of the school. The last five years I was responsible for the finances of the society. This meant collecting money from all parents and being responsible for the budget and spending of it.

skills: Management of cooperations with academic partners
